definition: a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
to receive in no small measure
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
